Warlords and heroes alike often fell their enemies and leave the corpses behind, exposed to the elements. [Undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) tend to rise in the dark of night and shun the cleansing rays of the sun, but this isn't the rule for all undead. The corpse of a particularly evil individual left exposed to the constant beating of the sun might become a sunburst corpse. These undead radiate light and wield sunlight as a weapon. Sunburst corpses initially seek revenge for their deaths but thereafter wander with undirected rage. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 34 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 [Sunburst Corpse](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1666) **Source** [Pathfinder #172: Secrets of the Temple City](/Sources.aspx?ID=102) pg. 85 **Perception** +25; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +23, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +29, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +25 **Str** +5 **Dex** +1 **Con** +8 **Int** +1 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +7 **Light Camouflage** The sunburst corpse is [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) in areas of natural bright light, such as due to sunlight or [torches](/Equipment.aspx?ID=60), even to creatures that can see clearly in bright light. Magical bright light and light from the sunburst corpse's blinding aura don't conceal the sunburst corpse. --- **AC** 35 **Fort** +28 **Ref** +21 **Will** +25 **HP** 255 **Immunities** [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1), [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) **Weaknesses** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 10, darkness vulnerability **Blinding Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) 60 feet. The sunburst corpse sheds bright light. Any creature that starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a DC 31 Fortitude save. If it fails, it's [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 minute, and if it critically fails, it's blinded permanently. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to this effect for 24 hours.
**Darkness Vulnerability** A sunburst corpse is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) while in areas of magical [darkness](/Traits.aspx?ID=39). If the level of the magical darkness effect is at least half of the sunburst corpse's level (a 7th-level effect against most sunburst corpses), the sunburst corpse is also [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) while in the area. --- **Speed** 35 feet **Melee** claw +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 3d6+13 slashing plus 2d8 fire and [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) and residual light **Ranged** sunfire +25 ([range increment 40 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 7d6 fire **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 2d6+6 bludgeoning plus 2d8 fire and residual light, DC 34 **Nova Burst** ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The sunburst corpse intensifies its light and unleashes a burning blast of energy. It deals 12d8 fire damage to all creatures in a 20-foot emanation (DC 34 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). A creature that fails its save becomes [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) until the end of its next turn. The sunburst corpse can't use Nova Burst again for 1d4 rounds, and its blinding aura becomes inactive during this time. **Residual Light** ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) When a sunburst corpse Strikes or Grapples a creature, some of the corpse's light clings to the creature for a moment. The creature must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) until the end of its next turn. On a critical failure, the creature is dazzled for 1 minute. A dazzled creature can use an Interact action to wick off the light and remove the dazzled condition.
Deathless Light A sunburst corpse's dead flesh is a [spell catalyst](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1452).
name: Sunburst Corpse
